Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with immigration laws
Crimes.Violation_Type: Non-compliance with immigration status and deportation grounds
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonable apprehension of bias in administrative decision-making
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant accused of serious crimes in the Philippines and subject to deportation; adjudicator referenced prior findings and criticized counsel
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Adjudicator's decision set aside due to bias concerns
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Reasonable apprehension of bias established; decision overturned
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Alleged fugitive from justice, credibility issues noted
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Bias, lack of fair hearing, constitutional validity of deportation provisions
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Informed person would reasonably believe decision-maker could not be impartial
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Prior involvement and prejudicial remarks by adjudicator
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under section 82.1 of the Immigration Act
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's credibility questioned based on charges and flight from Philippines
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Charging documents from the Philippines, prior adjudication records
Crimes.Application_Basis: Reasonable grounds to believe commission of serious crime abroad
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Philippine criminal charges and applicant’s conduct
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Quashing of deportation order and new hearing
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 7 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of full disclosure and procedural fairness concerns
Crimes.Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for rehearing
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk to fairness of proceedings due to perceived bias
Crimes.Cause_Description: Deportation sought based on foreign criminal charges
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reliance on foreign charging documents without full evidentiary hearing
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Potential breach of section 7 Charter rights
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient opportunity for applicant to respond to allegations
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Applicant present in Canada but subject to removal
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Canadian immigration authorities asserting jurisdiction over foreign criminal conduct
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Adjudicator relied on formal charges and credibility concerns
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Pre-judgment evident through language used and failure to recuse
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Use of untested foreign charges as basis for deportation

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Criminal deportation based on foreign charges
Crimes.Threat_Source: Applicant allegedly involved in violent attack
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Seriousness of the offense, international flight
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Charged with multiple violent offenses in the Philippines
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – offense punishable by ten years or more
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Based on charging documents and credibility assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Partially accepted, but concerns about procedural fairness
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant deemed less credible due to flight and prior findings
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk if returned, but also risk to public safety
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Potential for reoffending or evading justice
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Incident occurred in the Philippines, proceedings in Canada
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canadian immigration law applied to foreign criminal conduct
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision set aside due to bias, matter remanded
Crimes.Outcome: Rehearing ordered before a different adjudicator
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Bias, lack of recusal, constitutional challenges
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Judicial review under section 82.1 of the Immigration Act
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe standard under immigration law

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Outcome: Decision set aside due to adjudicator bias
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Process amounts to disguised extradition violating section 7 of the Charter
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Demonstration of state compulsion or coordination with foreign government
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Deportation based on inadmissibility, not extradition treaty
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada asserting sovereign authority over immigration decisions
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Applicant claims protection from unfair removal
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Transnational legal dispute between Philippines and Canada
Crimes.Legal_Statute: Immigration Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether process functions as de facto extradition
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Due process, right to fair hearing, liberty interests
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Section 7 Charter protection of life, liberty, and security
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Against removal to face trial under potentially unfair conditions
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Potential for unfair trial or punishment abroad
Crimes.Credibility: Applicant’s credibility challenged; state’s rationale scrutinized
Crimes.Targeted_Group: Individuals facing deportation over foreign charges
Crimes.State_Protection_Adequacy: Concerns raised about fairness of foreign proceedings
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Legal and personal security risks upon return
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Non-citizen with alleged foreign criminal charges
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Immigration inadmissibility based on seriousness of alleged crime
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Not applicable – claimant is the accused

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Deportation based on foreign murder charge
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Seriousness of the offense, international flight
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Presumption of innocence, procedural defects in hearing
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Multiple charges including murder and attempted murder

Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Accepted prima facie but not fully tested
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant viewed as less credible due to flight and demeanor
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk to public safety and flight risk
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Crime in Philippines, legal response in Canada
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canadian immigration jurisdiction over foreign nationals

Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision set aside due to bias
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Bias, lack of disclosure, constitutional concerns
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Application for judicial review under section 82.1
